title.narrative: Young African Leaders Initiative (YALI) - Niger Bio-Plast

description.narrative: Nigerbioplast is a company dedicated to environmental protection through the sale of their mobile toilets, of which 80% are made from recycled materials such as pallets. To avoid water contamination from public defecation, septic tanks will be built with a system of bacterial drain to protect populations from fecal-oral diseases. Two toilets will be installed in each Senegalese commune. The use of these toilets will be charged against a sum of 0.16 dollars per passage. For each toilet a woman will be hired to take care of the maintenance and collection of user fees. This will raise the coverage rate to 100% for the municipalities and will reach 10% of the city's population.

title.narrative: Telawas Valley Cooperatives Union (Union des Coopratives de la Vallee de Telawas (UCVT))

description.narrative: The project funds will be used to construct a compound in Telawas that will be used as a distribution point for production inputs to its members and a collection center for their agricultural production. Funds will also finance the construction of a trading center in Agadez where the Union markets its produce. This expansion will enable UCVT members to reduce storage and transport losses and increase the volume of produce sold as well as the revenues earned by Union members.
